required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: International Melanoma Algorithm Training Study - IMATS
clinical_study.official_title: An International, Multicenter, Prospective, Non-controlled, Non-randomised, Clinical Study to Collect Impedance Data of Potentially Malignant Pigmented Nevi and Histological Diagnoses

brief_summary.textblock: This is an international, multicenter, prospective, non controlled, non randomized, clinical study to collect electrical impedance data of potentially malignant pigmented nevi and histological diagnoses (International Melanoma Algorithm Training Study [IMATS]). The study objective is to collect data for training and optimization of an algorithm that can classify skin lesions using electrical impedance, i.e., to identify malignant melanomas.

primary_outcome.measure: Outcome measure not applicable. This is an algorithm training study.

intervention.description: Following enrollment, patients will undergo measurements with SciBase III Electrical Impedance Spectrometer. Electrical impedance of the skin will be measured with a microinvasive spiked probe.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women of any ethnic group
- Lesion located on normal healthy skin
- Maximum number of eight lesions per patient
- etc.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lesion under finger and toe nails
- Lesion located on eczema, psoriasis areas or similar
- Lesion located on scars
- etc.

facility.name: Sahlgrenska University Hospital, Dpt. of Dermatology
